video.title: TED Talks: The Best of TEDx in Español
video.synopsis: In the spirit of TED's mantra -- ideas worth spreading -- these innovative talks represent the best of TEDx in español.

episodes.synopsis: Cristina Domenech describes her powerful experience of helping incarcerated criminals understand and express themselves through creative writing.
episodes.title: Cristina Domenech: Poetry That Frees the Soul

episodes.synopsis: In this entertaining talk, Eduardo Sáenz de Cabezón describes the wonders of mathematics and its fundamental role in the sciences.
episodes.title: Eduardo Sáenz de Cabezón: What Is Math Good For?

episodes.synopsis: Health worker Romina Libster explains the concept of "herd immunity" and how it can protect even the un-vaccinated from dangerous diseases.
episodes.title: Romina Libster: The Power of Herd Immunity

episodes.synopsis: Julio Aranovich explains how he created a Web site to fact-check politicians, whose claims are often parroted uncritically by mainstream media.
episodes.title: Julio Aranovich: Fact and Fiction: Truth’s Role in the Public Discourse

episodes.synopsis: Agricultural engineer Magui Choque Vilca describes the underappreciated cultural importance of Argentina's plethora of potato varieties.
episodes.title: Magui Choque Vilca: What I've Learned From Potatoes

episodes.synopsis: Luis von Ahn describes how learning a new language can help individuals' personal lives and be a benefit to society as a whole.
episodes.title: Luis von Ahn: How to Learn a Language -- and Give Back to Society

episodes.synopsis: Activist Estela de Carlotto describes her quest for justice for her daughter, who was kidnapped in 1977 by dictatorial government forces in Argentina.
episodes.title: Estela de Carlotto: A Grandmother's Fight to Rescue the Disappeared

episodes.synopsis: Ariel Lutenberg describes his revolutionary Argentine Open Industrial Computer, an open-source tech project that empowers local engineers.
episodes.title: Ariel Lutenberg: How We Built a Home-Grown, Open-Source, Industrial Computer

episodes.synopsis: Paula Sibilia discusses the changing attitudes toward childhood bullying and the importance of these perspectives in developing anti-bullying methods.
episodes.title: Paula Sibilia: Shame Over Guilt: Bullying and a Shift in Social Control

episodes.synopsis: Alejandro Nadra explains how scientists can use synthetic biology to create organisms for specific tasks, such as bacteria that can fight disease.
episodes.title: Alejandro Nadra: How We Designed Problem-Solving Organisms
